definition: Learning through group interaction, peer discussion, and collective knowledge construction

positive_examples: Students worked in small groups to solve the problem together.
The jigsaw activity had each team member become an expert to teach others.
Peer discussion helped students articulate and refine their understanding.
Learning happens through dialogue and negotiation of meaning with others.
negative_examples: Each student worked independently at their desk.
The test was taken individually with no communication allowed.
The teacher called on students one at a time to answer.
